item.title: New NML website launched
item.description: We have launched a new website. Many thanks to the Kording Lab for the template!

item.title: New prespective out on deep neuroscience
item.description: New perspective out in Nature Neuroscience on deep learning as a framework for neuroscience.

item.title: Samia got (short) paper accepted at the RL NeurIPS workshop
item.description: Samia (MSc student) had a short paper accepted at the RL NeurIPS workshop.

item.title: New review on model-based synaptic transmission inference
item.description: Our review on model-based synaptic transmission inference now out in Frontiers in Synaptic Neurosience [Special Issue on Methods for Synaptic Interrogation].

item.title: NeurIPS 2019 workshop on biological and artificial reinforcement learning
item.description: Together with reseachers at Imperial College London, McGill University, Deepmind, MILA and others we are organising a NeurIPS workshop on biological and artificial reinforcement learning. More info here.

item.title: Rui kayaks Kenneth and Avon Canal for AvonNeedsTrees
item.description: Rui kayaked the Kenneth and Avon canal (~90 miles) for AvonNeedsTrees

item.title: Milton had (short) paper accepted at CCN
item.description: Milton had (short) paper accepted at the Computational Cognitive Neuroscience Conference on gated-RNNs for working memory.

item.title: David passed his PhD viva with minor corrections!
item.description: David passed his PhD viva at the University of Oxford with minor corrections, congrats!

item.title: William Greedy awarded EPSRC studentship​
item.description: After a MSc in Machine Learning and CompNeuro at the University of Edinburgh, William Greedy, was just awarded a EPSRC studentship to do his PhD in our group!​​​​

item.title: Anne-Lene does summer research visit with Wei Ji Ma (NYU)
item.description: Anne-Lene is spending the summer at New York University working with Wei Ji Ma.

item.title: Bristol CNU launched new website
item.description: The Bristol Computational Neuroscience Unit have launched a new website. Many thanks to the Kording Lab for the template!

item.title: Posters accepted at UK Neural Computation 2019
item.description: Milton, Raymond and Callum had two posters accepted at the UK Neural Computation 2019 meeting.

item.title: Joe Pemberton awarded EPSRC studentship​
item.description: After a MSc in Machine Learning and Compneuro at the University of Edinburgh, Joe Pemberton, was just awarded a EPSRC studentship to do his PhD in our group!​​​​

item.title: Raymond with poster accepted at COSYNE 2019
item.description: Raymond got a poster accepted at COSYNE’2019, in sweet Lisbon, Portugal.

item.title: New review on the computational roles of plastic probabilistic synapses
item.description: Our review on the computational roles of plastic probabilistic synapses is now out in Current Opinion in Neurobiology (w/ Llera-Montero M and Sacramento J)
